title: Identifier
description: Identifiers are keys that are owned by either the sender, receiver or a third party. If the keys used are owned by either sender or receiver, no meta data has to be specified by means of attributes. The table below specifies the use of attributes for the identifier types when they are owned by a third party.

example-2.schemeAgencyName: Gesch√§fts- und Koordinierungsstelle LeiKa beim Ministerium der Finanzen des Landes Sachsen-Anhalt (GK_LEIKA)

id.description: A character string to identify and distinguish uniquely, one instance of an object in an identification scheme from all other objects in the same scheme together with relevant supplementary information.

schemeURI.description: Link to the location of the list scheme

schemeDataURI.description: Link to the location of the list

schemeAgencyName.description: Specifies the name of the ID issuer

schemeAgencyId.description: Specifies the ID of the ID issuer
